snippet: Lawyers for Shakil Afridi, the Pakistani doctor who helped the C.I.A. find Osama bin Laden, lodged an appeal on Friday to overturn his conviction.
abstract: Lawyers for Shakil Afridi, Pakistani doctor who helped the Central Intelligence Agency find Osama bin Laden, lodge an appeal to overturn his conviction, which related to charges of aiding the militant group Lashkar-i-Islam; claim that Afridi had no links with Lashkar-i-Islam, and that he did not receive a fair trial.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Shakil Afridi, the Pakistani doctor who helped the C.I.A. find Osama bin Laden, lodged an appeal on Friday to overturn his conviction.
